SEARCH

Class Player

java.lang.Object
Player
Direct Known Subclasses:
InventoryManager
public class Player extends Object
ASCIIADVENTURER Caden Finley Albert Tucker Grijesh Shrestha This class represents a player in the ASCII Adventure game. It contains attributes and methods to manage the player's state and actions.
Version:
1.0
Author:
ASCIIADVENTURERS

    • playerStart

      public static void playerStart() throws InterruptedException
      Initializes the player with default values and starts the player.
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted while waiting

      Throws:

    • getName

      public static String getName()
      Retrieves the name of the player.
      Returns:
      the name of the player, or the literal string "null" if the name is not set or is empty

    • setName

      public static void setName(String name)
      Sets the name of the player.
      Parameters:
      name - the name to set

    • getHealth

      public static int getHealth()
      Gets the current health of the player. If the health exceeds the maximum health, it is set to the maximum health.
      Returns:
      the current health

    • getMaxHealth

      public static int getMaxHealth()
      Gets the maximum health of the player.
      Returns:
      the maximum health

    • getGold

      Gets the current amount of gold the player has.
      Returns:
      the amount of gold

    • changeInventorySize

      public static void changeInventorySize(int change) throws InterruptedException
      Changes the inventory size by a specified amount.
      Parameters:
      change - the amount to change the inventory size by
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted

    • getInventorySize

      public static int getInventorySize()
      Gets the current inventory size.
      Returns:
      the inventory size

    • hardSetInventorySize

      public static void hardSetInventorySize(int size)
      Sets the inventory size to a specified value.
      Parameters:
      size - the size to set the inventory to

    • changeHealth

      public static void changeHealth(int change) throws InterruptedException
      Changes the health of the player by a specified amount. If the change is negative, it is adjusted by the player's defense and damage. If the health drops to zero or below, the player dies and the game ends.
      Parameters:
      change - the amount to change the health by
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted

    • fairyHeal

      public static boolean fairyHeal()
      Heals the player to full health if not already at max health.
      Returns:
      true if the player was healed, false if already at max health

    • getDamageCalc

      public static int getDamageCalc()
      Calculates the damage dealt by the player.
      Returns:
      the calculated damage

    • changeMaxHealth

      public static void changeMaxHealth(int change) throws InterruptedException
      Changes the player's maximum health by a specified amount.
      Parameters:
      change - the amount to change the max health by
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted

    • changeGold

      public static void changeGold(int change) throws InterruptedException
      Changes the player's gold by a specified amount.
      Parameters:
      change - the amount to change the gold by
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted

      public static void openInventory() throws InterruptedException
      Opens the inventory and prints its contents.
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted while opening the inventory

    • getInventory

      public static String getInventory()
      Gets the string representation of the player's inventory.
      Returns:
      the inventory as a string

    • putItem

      public static Boolean putItem(String item, int amount) throws InterruptedException
      Adds an item to the player's inventory.
      Parameters:
      item - The name of the item to be added.
      amount - The quantity of the item to be added.
      Returns:
      True if the item was successfully added, false otherwise.
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - If the thread is interrupted while waiting for user input.

    • printStats

      public static void printStats() throws InterruptedException
      Prints the player's stats to the console.
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted while printing stats

    • heal

      public static void heal() throws InterruptedException
      Heals the player using available health potions from the inventory.
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted while waiting.

    • copyInventory

      public static Map<String,Integer> copyInventory()
      Copies the inventory.
      Returns:
      a map representing the inventory with item names as keys and their quantities as values.

    • printMap

      public static void printMap() throws InterruptedException
      This method prints the game map to the console. It updates the map with the player's position and the status of the dungeons based on the number of completed dungeons.
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted while sleeping

    • hasRoomInInventory

      public static Boolean hasRoomInInventory(int amount)
      Checks if there is enough room in the inventory to add a specified amount of items.
      Parameters:
      amount - the number of items to be added to the inventory
      Returns:
      true if there is enough room in the inventory, false otherwise

    • playerSetSave

      public static void playerSetSave(String localName, int localHealth, int localMaxHealth, int localGold, Map<String,Integer> localInventory, int localInventorySize)
      Sets the player's attributes.
      Parameters:
      localName - the name of the player
      localHealth - the current health of the player
      localMaxHealth - the maximum health of the player
      localGold - the amount of gold the player has
      localInventory - the inventory of the player, represented as a map of item names to their quantities
      localInventorySize - the size of the player's inventory

    • changeName

      public static void changeName() throws InterruptedException
      Changes the name of the player. Prompts the user to enter a new name and validates the input. If the input is valid, the player's name is updated. If the user types "exit", the start menu is displayed.
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted while waiting for user input

    • drawHealthBar

      public static void drawHealthBar()
      Draws the health bar for the player. The health bar is represented by a series of colored bars and underscores. The color of the bars changes based on the player's current health. - Green: Health is more than half of the maximum health. - Yellow: Health is between half and a quarter plus a tenth of the maximum health. - Red: Health is less than or equal to a quarter plus a tenth of the maximum health. The health bar is printed to the console.

    • getColorOfPlayerPostitionTile

      public static String getColorOfPlayerPostitionTile()
      This method returns the environment type of the player's current position on the map. The map is represented as a 2D array of strings, where each string corresponds to a specific environment type. The method uses a predefined mapping of color codes to environment types to determine the environment type.
      Returns:
      A string representing the environment type of the player's current position. Possible values are "grassland", "desert", "mountain top", "ocean", "mountain", "lost forest", or "unknown".

    • getCompassDirectionToClosestVillage

      public static String getCompassDirectionToClosestVillage()
      This method calculates the compass direction to the closest village from the player's current position.
      Returns:
      A string representing the compass direction to the closest village. Possible values are: "North", "Northeast", "East", "Southeast", "South", "Southwest", "West", "Northwest", or "No village found".

    • getCompassDirectionToClosestDungeon

      public static String getCompassDirectionToClosestDungeon()
      Returns the compass direction to the closest dungeon based on the player's current position.
      Returns:
      A string representing the compass direction to the closest dungeon.

    • getNextDungeon

      public static String getNextDungeon()
      Returns the name of the next dungeon based on the number of completed dungeons.
      Returns:
      the name of the next dungeon or a completion message if all dungeons are completed.

    • distanceToVillage

      public static int distanceToVillage()
      Calculates the distance from the player's current position to the closest village on the map.
      Returns:
      the distance to the closest village, or -1 if no village is found.

    • distanceToNextDungeon

      public static int distanceToNextDungeon()
      Calculates the distance to the next dungeon based on the current state of the map and the number of completed dungeons.
      Returns:
      the distance to the next dungeon, or -1 if no dungeon is found.
